info.description:
Documentation for Spiget  
Spiget is an API to quickly and easily get information about Spigot plugins, resources and authors
info.title: Spiget

get.description:
Get a list of available authors
Note: This only includes members involved with resources, either being their author or having reviewed a resource

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Field to sort by. (Use a +/- prefix for ascending/descending order)

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Fields to return, separated by commas

X-Page-Sort.description: Field the elements are sorted by

X-Page-Size.description: Number of elements on the current page

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Fields to return, separated by commas

X-Page-Sort.description: Field the elements are sorted by

X-Page-Size.description: Number of elements on the current page

get.description:
Download a specific resource version

Note: This only redirects to the stored download location and might not download a file (i.e. for external resources)

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Field to sort by. (Use a +/- prefix for ascending/descending order)

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Fields to return, separated by commas

X-Page-Sort.description: Field the elements are sorted by

X-Page-Size.description: Number of elements on the current page

get.description: Get a list of available events

post.description:
Register a new Webhook

Use this form to easily register a new one: https://spiget.org/webhook/

get.description: Get the status of a Webhook

links.description: Map of external and custom links in the resource description

external.description: Whether this resource is external (not hosted on SpigotMC.org)

releaseDate.description: Timestamp of the version's release date

likes.description: Amount of likes for this update

responseMessage.description: Base64-Encoded message the author responded with

version.description: Version name the review was posted for

index.description: Resource index on the current page

start.description: Timestamp of the last fetcher start

active.description: Whether the fetcher is currently active

end.description: Timestamp of the last fetcher end (0 if currently active)
